texts: Due to the improvement works at Wembley Park Underground Station, buses will
replace trains on the Jubilee line between Neasden and Kingsbury on
Saturday and Sunday on 14-15 and 21-22 May.
The work is being undertaken by Tube Lines.
Kevin Bootle, Jubilee line General Manager, said: "Wembley Park Station is undergoing a major reconstruction.

"This will make it more pleasant to use and increase the station's capacity so that it will be ready for the opening of the new Wembley Stadium.

"I hope customers will bear with us, but when this work is completed it will bring real benefits to passengers."

A Rail Replacement Bus service will operate between Neasden and Kingsbury, calling at Wembley Park.

A 15-minute train service will operate between Stanmore and Kingsbury.
Passengers should allow an extra 40 minutes for their journeys.
For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call: 020 7222 1234 or visit www.tfl.gov.uk .
